title: Nice!
comment: Open source or not, the developer deserves support. It's a nice text editor and I find it does everything I need. I just wish AIDE would developed something as good!

title: update
comment: it was a bit choppy but with the last update everything got buttery smooth. well done.

title: Awesome Little Text Editor.
comment: The perfect resource for editing code on my mobile.~Samsung Galaxy Note 4, Android 5+

title: Great
comment: Really good editor. Not sure why it needs the In App purchases permission though. But a solid, well thought out editor.

title: Beautiful and Fully Stacked
comment: All the features are there and compatibility is wide-ranging. Highly recommended. My only gripe is I want to be a able to create a new file and start jotting notes, but Turbo Editor forces me to name and save a file first before I can start jotting. This inconvenience means I tend to use Google Keep more than Turbo Editor

title: Bugs- Galaxy Note 3 multi window
comment: If using with Galaxy Note multi window this App is not recommended. DroidEdit is the one to go for.
Works on large files!

title: Wow... Finally an editor with proper encoding/decoding for UTF-8/16
comment: This is the only text editor I've seen that doesn't force close when using string filters. Dev even included premade filters. How about giving us the option of coding our own filters though.

title: Improving...
comment: Only options to open files are Google drive, images, etc. Don't see a way to browse local files. Update: This developer has been very responsive. I had a problem with the free version and he was very responsive then, too. This app is a work in progress. It's not bad for a simple editor, but it's not quite ready for prime yet. 3 stars for now.

Hi Sam, to open local files you have two options: the first one is to enable "Show SD card" from the screen containing all the files. The second one is to go in the preferences and disable "kitkat selection". If you need help send me an email and I will be happy to help you! :)
whinged, prompt dev response and fixed..
Hi Tim, I'm sorry to hear that. The new update should fix that! :)

title: Best Text Editor for Android
comment: This app is head and shoulders above the other android text editors I have tried. It's almost as good as PC packages out there. Developers are active and listen to feedback. Just waiting for a couple of syntax highlighting bugs to be fixed.

title: Pleased with the developers
comment: I was afraid I would end up regretting paying for this app but the developer responded to my complaints and promptly delivered an update that solved my issues. While far from being perfect, I am happy enough with the purchase especially if this experience is any indication of the direction of its development. There are some bugs and some more features would be nice but as of right now I am content.
Hi Di, I should have fixed this bug in the last version. If not feel free to drop me an email!

title: Needs more features
comment: Such as JavaScript, HTML, and cssauto complete and CSS preprocessor support. I'd pay for more then $2 for such an ide. Much more.

title: Better than DroidEdit Pro
comment: Simple, open source, and it works.
Great text editor!

title: The best text editor
comment: This is a great text editor. It is fast and has a very intuitive, simple UI. Thanks

title: Thats it!
comment: Great app, thanks!

title: Blazingly fast app with stunning interface
comment: While Turbo Editor doesn't natively support ftp files like droid editor does, it integrates much better with an ftp client - seriously! Droid Editor, is great, in fact I use both, but slow on phones like mine. Turbo Editor works great with Turbo FTP and is blazingly fast.

title: Bug Found.
comment: When typing at any time the blinking line will just auto bounce to top of page. Even when backspacing text it will bounce and start deleting text from a different line. It's extremely annoying. Makes editing code very difficult.
Hi Adam, please send me an email so we can fix the problem. Thanks!

title: Where indents
comment: Where indents for code?
By far the best text editor for Android
